description: Buy the Stages Cycling Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stages Cycling Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm
review.reviewBody:
Once I started power training, and riding >2hrs, it became more apparent to me to target power zones over HR or speed.  Perceived exertion is the best, but after 5 days in the saddle, the power reports don't lie.

I don't have enough money to buy 4 quarq meters, so... stages is far more economical.

I started with my gravel rig, then my wife's, then my XC mnt bike... now one for my wife's XC mnt bike.  

Of the 3 we own, my wife's gravel bike meter measures 10-15% above her indoor trainer (perceived), but it's consistent. 

We have only SRAM cranks.  Easy to install.  Make sure you get the correct spindle.  I required an additional spacer on my XC bike to get the right spacing for my 1x12 DUB Eagle XO1 crank set that I needed my LBS to sort out, but now that it's on, no issues.

Paired well with my previous Garmin 500, and now Wahoo Bolt without any issues.

As for the crazy numbers in the previous post... mine did the same, and I had to re-calibrate 3 times, meter in the 6 o'clock position only on my mnt bike.  Now it's consistent with my indoor trainer, my gravel bike, and has been rock solid.  I was getting computer drop outs with my Garmin 500, but not an issue with the Wahoo bolt
review.name: Own 3, going on 4 (4 different bikes)

review.itemreviewed: Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm
review.reviewBody:
It's always easier to leave a review on something personal, like clothing. With a power meter, it's binary - either it works or it doesn't. This one does not work. Stages seems like a good company, so I'll chalk this up to that one-off malfunctioning piece that comes off the line.

Competitive Cyclist is always great and had no questions when I called to request a refund. They sent over the shipping label right away.

The details of my "did not work" comment are as follows: I installed the crank arm and tested it out with the Stages app on my street one night, and aside from some sporadic readings, the majority of the power numbers seemed reasonable. The next day I went on my normal "break in" mountain bike ride to see how the power meter would perform when paired to my Garmin. For the first two miles it was ok. Then I saw some crazy numbers (over 3000) even when I was not pedaling. At about mile 5-6, the meter stopped altogether - read zero for about 30-45 minutes. At that point I tried it with the Stages app thinking it was a connection issue between it and my Garmin, but even when connected to their app, no data was coming through. Toward the end of my ride (about mile 18), it started showing watts again, and they again seemed reasonable, but by that point my confidence in the product was gone. This is an expensive accessory, and I can't justify that price for the unreliability.
review.name: Did not work
comment: Shane V. & if he didn't have the proper spindle for his bike/crankset, he wouldn't have been able to install it or ride at all. Highly doubt the spindle (which is just a hunk of threaded aluminum) had anything to do with his issue. The Stages power meters work by measure force in the crank arm itself, nothing to do with the spider or spindle.
If you didn't get the spindle that works with your bike as well. It probably causes this problem.

name: Carbon 30mm/386EVO L Gen 3 Power Meter Crank Arm

review.name: Great bag. Only wish the

review.reviewBody: This pack is beyond what I expected. This pack is my number one favorite traveling pack, the daypack is a great addition, I love that it's removable and accommodates the little things I like to carry while traveling. I will recommend this pack to my friends and family.
review.name: Everything I want in a travel pack!

review.reviewBody: I took this backpack on a 2 week trip to Central Asia. I was able to bring it on the plane as a carry on, even though it is pretty large. The smaller backpack is great for walking around the city and hiking for shorter day trips. Great quality bag. Although a seam on the small backpack strap opened a bit on the hem, which can be fixed, it doesn't take away from the integrity of the product. My husband and teenager have also taken this bag hiking and traveling and is still in great shape. I highly recommend.
review.name: Love this backpack

review.reviewBody: Pro: Women XS is a great size for me as a carry-on. The frame is 21.5"" high for XS. It's well-designed for traveling, allowing you to hide the straps for check-in. I've had no problems using it as a carry-on for 5 flights so far. Con: I'm right on the margin between XS and one size up. However, with the XS, I cannot fully tighten the sternum strap, causing it to tilt backward slightly at the top.
review.name: XS great size for travelling

review.reviewBody: I use this for backpacking around the world and have been using it for 2 years straight. I recommend it to everybody.
review.name: Have been using for 2 years non stop

description: Buy the 45NRTH Ragnarok MTN 2-Bolt Cycling Boot online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ragnarok MTN 2-Bolt Cycling Boot
hasVariant.description: Buy the 45NRTH Ragnarok MTN 2-Bolt Cycling Boot online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Super comfy right out of the box and toasty toes even riding in 35* temps
review.name: Warm toes!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these to ride through the winter/ spring last year, and I'm so glad I did. I tried shoe covers one time and the experience was so miserable I bit the bullet and went for the shoes. Best decision I made. These aren't meant for extremely cold temps, but I'm usually on the trainer when it's THAT cold out. I love these for Michigan's shoulder seasons - these had me riding in November/ December, and as early as March this past year. The Boas are a little finicky, and I do wish they were slightly easier to slip on and off without having to loosen everything, but at this point, going into my second season of wearing these, I'm used to it now.
review.name: Heading into Second Season

review.reviewBody: I bought the Ragnarok to replace the older version of this shoe, the Japanther.  It fits fine, performs fine. The only detractor is the Boa adjustment is very difficult to get out of. Once you pop the Boa out you have to spend a minute or so loosening up the wire lace enough to get your foot out.  It's not terrible, but it should be fixed.
review.name: Very good shoe, with some exception

review.reviewBody: I'm always a 44.  Have the Wolfgaars in 44 and they're perfect.  These are tight!  Will need to size up, right big toe is rubbing up against boot with normal (not thick) socks.  The quality seems horrible.  No where near the quality as the wolfgaars I got last year.  The boas are different.  It's hard to pull the slack out of them to loosen them.  In order to get these on you need maximum slack.  Seems like boas are already on the verge of breaking.  These are going back, not sure if its worth trying a size 45 because these seem really cheaply made.  Disappointing for $157 you would think 45Nrth could do better.
review.name: Yikes

name: Ragnarok MTN 2-Bolt Cycling Boot

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The Oboz Sypes hiking boots are exactly what I need. They are comfortable and firm for stability. The traction is so much better than I have had with past hiking boots. I needlessly worried about the boots being too warm in the summer. I like the fact that they are waterproof. My skinny ankles feel better protected. I bought the slate color which had the lowest price of the color options. I am very satisfied.
review.name: More than happy!

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these boots (after trying a few different brands) and they are AMAZING !
No break in period required - SO comfortable and I hiked part of the Alps in Switzerland shortly after buying them. Great traction and fit.  I've gotten compliments from other hikers about how cool they are.  I quickly ordered another pair since my history has been that when I go to replace a product I LOVE, it's no longer available to purchase.  Now I'm set !
review.name: Best boot ever !

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these for two months.  They are comfortable, super stable, and truly waterproof. Best boots I’ve ever owned. They also look sharp and offer great traction
review.name: Fantastic boots

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a narrow foot and have a hard time finding shoes that fit good and are comfortable and supportive too. This is my second pair of Oboz and they both  fit perfectly and are extremely comfortable, even the first time I wore them on a walk.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for camping in Iceland West Fjords. Did not have a chance to break them in and was worried. But hiked 8hrs/day for 3 days over mountains, through streams, seaweed, mud and 2+ ft snow and they stayed dry and perfectly comfortable!! Sized up based on reviews.
review.name: Exceeded expectations!

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Second pair of Oboz, best fit I’ve found in years of hiking. 
Everyone’s foot is different, but I hit the trails and never worry about blisters, rubbing or sore bruised feet from rocks.  Hiking hundreds of miles and switch out boots, socks depending on weather and terrain, always pleased with Oboz.
review.name: Comfortable from day one!

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So happy with this shoe. It's so supportive and so comfortable. It's an all year hiking shoe for me. Does great in wet and dry climates. I purchased the thyme and love that color!!!
review.name: Very Pleased!

name: Sypes Mid Leather B-DRY Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: This jacket has been a great layering piece, as well as a standalone shoulder season jacket. On really cold rides (around 32F) I can comfortably fit a long sleeve base layer, wool jersey, and a long sleeve thermal jersey under this jacket withouth feeling too constrained. This spring I've been using it as shoulder season jacket and it breathes quite well, and I haven't gotten the swampy, sweaty feeling when I start to warm up on climbs. It's easy to shed and shove in a jersey pocket. I would recommend sizing down in this jacket, as the sizing does run large and the small is bigger than typical small jackets I've had in the past. A small seems to fit closer to a medium in other brands. Overall a fanstastic jacket and I find myself reaching for this anytime the temps start to dip!
review.name: Top Notch Quality

name: Cinder Borealis Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Topeak SmartGauge D2 Pressure Gauge online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SmartGauge D2 Pressure Gauge
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak SmartGauge D2 Pressure Gauge online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Many of the negative reviews seem to be a result of not reading the included instructions/user error. In my hands the reading seem accurate. I ran comparisons using the integrated analog gauge on my floor pump, a stand-alone analog tire, and even checked against the TPMS readings on my car. All agreed within an acceptable level of tolerance. 

For the bleeding and re-checking function, you can monitor the changing pressure as you release air, you just need to follow the instructions included with the gauge. I have successfully done this with 4 different tired on two bikes.
review.name: Great if you read/follow instructions

review.reviewBody: not accurate, doesn't monitor pressure as you release air through the device. honestly this is worthless
review.name: complete waste of money

review.reviewBody:
Seems well made but there a several areas I think are poor design.
1. The head needs to have some sort of recess to line up on the valve before you press to take a measurement.  Dont line up perfect then you will be grabbing your pump again because you will let out air while checking.
2. The ability to let air out and recheck is useless.  It does not show a new reading till you pull the gauge a way and reset.  You cant leave the gauge in place, let out some air and see the pressure fall to desired pressure.  And becasue of issue #1 you are likely unless ultra careful to let out more than desired

It is not junk but for the price should be better. I would not recommend.
review.name: Not as good as I hoped for

review.reviewBody: Only had the pressure gauge for a month and it stopped reading accurately. Didn't matter how much I pumped up the tire, it always read low at 7-8 psi. I reset it and still the same. Then it stopped working all together so I went to change the battery and noted some corrosion which is weird because it stays stored in a dry area of my house and has never gotten wet. I cleaned the corrosion and put a new battery in and it turned back on but still was reading the pressures wrong. maybe i just got a dud.
review.name: Not accurate at all

review.reviewBody: Very useful tool to keep on your pocket. Easy to use and very precise.
review.name: Very useful

name: SmartGauge D2 Pressure Gauge

review.reviewBody: Recently upgraded to this helmet for added safety and a better fit than the inexpensive "Hat" I had been wearing for years.  I was very pleasantly surprised at how high quality the overall construction of this helmet is.  You can tell it is a high end helmet.  The fit is really amazingly comfortable but also quite secure.  Also, airflow on warm days is outstanding and it channels sweat away from eyes very well.  The adjustable visor also comes in very handy for control of brightness in your eyes.  I would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for the same attributes I listed above.
review.name: Excellent fit and protection

name: Super Air Mips Helmet

description: Buy the HOKA Bondi 8 Wide Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bondi 8 Wide Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Bondi 8 Wide Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my11th pair of Hoka Bondi's so I think you know I love them. Most comfortable shoes I've had. I have flat feet, bad back and love to walk. I went through many brands until I found Hoka. They are pricey but so worth it. I'm waiting for a red color. I love pops of color.
review.name: Love my Bondi's

review.reviewBody: These were the most uncomfortable shoes I've ever worn. My feet were so achy after my 8 hour shift. I exchanged them for a different style.
review.name: If I could, I'd give zero stars

review.reviewBody: Standing, working & walking every day, all day.. My back, legs and feet are not hurting..
review.name: OMG!!! I Love my bondi 8...

review.reviewBody: My shoes fit perfectly (7.5) but when I tied my shoes the lip of the shoe literally cuts into my skin by the end of my work day. So weird so will get an 8 in the future. Otherwise the shoe itself does it job for my chronic pain (I work in a hospital) and performs better then Nikes in that respect
review.name: Go a half sized up

review.reviewBody: I love my Bondi 8!! It's wide on the front for toes to spread out, super comfy with its elevated sole. My daughter recommended the Bondi 8 to me, and I have no regrets. Got my husband to purchase one too.
review.name: My favorite Hoka!!

review.reviewBody: I ended up purchasing 4 pairs of shoes in increasingly larger sizes to accommodate a swollen foot and ankle brace from a broken fibula. Unfortunately, the box was thrown out on one pair so I can't return it. Returned one pair and keeping the other two in different sizes. I typically wear a size 9 in athletic shoes but the 9.5 wide fits perfectly and feels great on my normal foot. Just hoping the 10 wide will be as comfortable on the swollen foot!
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: I am so ticked off that I paid over $150 for these shoes. Warranty is a joke. They want me to send them back for evaluation and go without shoes. Hole broke in less than 2 months of wear due to the lace hole being punched too close. It is an obvious defect. They should send me a new pair and then I would send these back. Because of this I will do a full return and buy different brand from here on out. Hoka is not what it used to be :O(
review.name: JUNK

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Excellent support. My feet feel rested after a long 12-hour shift.
review.name: I will order again.

review.reviewBody: I love the Bondi 8! It is the perfect shoe for me. Great support and great cushioning. My feet are so messed up, I thought I would never find a shoe as perfect as these. I love all the great colors HOKA has. But these shoes are exceptionally beautiful! I am SO happy!
review.name: I LOVE this show!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Bondi's. There is ample room for the toes. Perhaps a little wider than I want but they do maintain support. I find these shoes work best on a treadmill and for squats.
review.name: COMFY AND SUPPORTIVE

name: Bondi 8 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This hat looks really good on and feels really high quality. It's comfortable too to wear since you can buy the right size for you.
review.name: Great quality for a great price

review.reviewBody: Happy with the blue color.  I measured at a small but went for a medium just because I have thicker hair.  It was a good choice.  Fits perfect!
review.name: Cute color!

review.reviewBody: The hat has just the right length of brim,  and just the right flounce in the brim.   It is cute and stylish, and can be dressed up or down.     I have trouble finding hats that fit right.    I have a small head, and most hats are usually too big.    I ended up with the xs, and  it fits perfectly.   Brixton is one of the few hat companies that makes just about all their hats in sizes xs through xl,   so one will definitely fit you right.   Before seeing Brixton on backcounty,  I had never heard of them.     Many manufacturers only make hats in one size or two sizes,  and I am sorry the "one size fits all" or "one size fits most"  doesn't work for many of us.    Additionally, the inside of the hat has a fine tune adjustment feature.    I initially purchased one hat, and then later when back and purchased 2 more.
review.name: Perfect little hat

review.reviewBody: This hat is perfect for my head. After trying two other fitted sized hats I gave this one a shot and immediately liked. The adjustment strap allows for the perfect fit!
review.name: Great hat

name: Wesley Fedora

review.reviewBody:
I've worn Pearl Izumi products for years, and they've always met my expectations, so this jacket sounded like a great addition to my cold-weather gear ...  This jacket is NOT warm enough for me (and I have PI jackets which ARE warm, but the light weight of this jacket  appealed to me).  Example: today was 48 and breezy, and I wore a Merino wool base layer under this jacket and I was still cold while cycling.  Since it is very light and not bulky, it IS suitable to layer under another jacket, but (at least for me) not to wear by itself in chilly weather.
Additionally, the description on the site is incorrect: there are NO rear pockets, only the small zippered chest pocket.  That further reduces its utility for me.
review.name: Disappointing

name: Expedition Pro Alpha Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am an active swimmer and wanted a top to keep the girls tucked in. This top fits the bill.
review.name: Fits well

review.reviewBody: Love the security this top gives me while playing in the water. It is also very cute. I think the main thing I didnt think about is that the compression amplifies the pit pooch more than other tops iv had.
review.name: You can belly flop and it wont budge

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful black top. Love the back cutout. I bought this to replace my black Stinson Top by Carve, which I love but has stretched out. 
This top has a great fit, giving 4 stars vs 5 as it slides down slightly on my shoulders.
review.name: Fitted, supportive top with great cutout in back!

review.reviewBody: Have not worn it swimming yet but know it will hold me well and be great for any water activities. I like the straps and the feel of the fabric, very soft. Because it is good compression, it does cut in a few areas pretty tightly. I worried if I went a larger size that it wouldn’t hold me enough. It should be fine over time though.
review.name: Good compression

review.reviewBody:
I got the big boob top and it was still much too tight for my 32DDD chest. 
It fit my back fine, but my boobs were spilling out the top, and the sides. I wish they made better tops out there for larger chested people… 
If I size up to fit my boobs, then it’s usually too big around my body.
review.name: Not great for big boobs

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: The thermal weight is perfect for most conditions I’ll want to be out in. I love how the sleeves are actually cut long enough and don’t ride up my forearm since I’m tall and many other brands are cut a few inches too short. True to size for Castilli, which is a small compared to other brands. I usually wear M/L but always get XL in Castelli.
review.name: My favorite jersey for chilly rides

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own several Castelli jerseys all size large and they fit fine. This jersey in a large in this very tight. I did not like the very stretchy material.
review.name: runs very small

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was looking for a fall/spring long sleeve road jersey with just a little more warmth than summer fabric, and this seemed like the best of the few options available.  The cloth is quite slinky and has just a hint of fleecy warmth without bulk.  Color is dye sub (on the surface) and you can see the white beneath where it stretches, but that's okay.  Good silicone gripper at the back, good cut around the neck & shoulders for riding position.  As with my other Castelli jerseys, this one runs 2 sizes small (I'm 5' 9" 160lbs, a MED in Pearl Izumi & Louis Garneau).  I tried the L as well but the torso was too snug.  Sleeves are longer than they should be, but they taper at the ends and it's never been an issue.  Good value for the $.
review.name: Usual Castelli oddities - but good

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My Husband lives this Jersey! So a second one has been ordered for him for Valentines day!  The first was for Christmas for a cool Cycling Theme. He looks fantastic in it, and really enjoys the fit. We had to size him up though, as Castelli runs really small.... But once we figured the sizing out, it was all good! He is 6' 2" tall and weights 170, and required an XL to fit his trim tall frame. Love Castelli! I have a pair of their cycling gloves, and love them too! 
Thank you Backcountry and Castelli!
review.name: Second One ordered for Valentines Day!

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased this jersey to fill the gap of arm warmers and the heavy fleece jersey. This Pisa mid is perfect. Can be worn alone when in the low 60s to low 50s. Throw on a base layer and vest and you are good anywhere high 30s+. The best part is the big flexible pockets for stuffing vests, knee warmers, and food for those long winter training rides.  

I'm 5'8 145lbs and the small is perfect. I like jerseys to fit tight and usually order xs- however, there is not an xs option in this, but the sm fits similar. It does run a bit small if you are in-between sizes. I just placed an order for another.
review.name: Best cool weather jersey I own.

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
6 feet / 170 lbs / 40? waist- I bought XL like all my Castelli gear. I have long arms and normally struggle finding long sleeves ...well the Pisa jersey has very lomgggggggg sleeves, so much I had to bring it to my tailor to cut 2 inches!! Cost me $15 on top- 
Now it fits nicely, even under my winter gloves- I can?t imagine who could wear such long sleeves....
Rest is good as Castellli quality standards, so if you are OK to cut piece of your New Jersey it deserves 4 stars- it will be my only Pisa ?customized? jersey for sure- will buy another model next time designed for non extraterrestrial bodies ??
review.name: Super long sleeves

name: Pisa Mid Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Gear Box 45L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpaca Gear Box 45L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Gear Box 45L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just took these on a 7000 miles in 3 weeks roadtrip, mix of tent camping and hotels. I have ZERO negative things to say about them. They took a lot of abuse and the only evidence is SLIGHT scratching of the lids. They were packed full, stacked on each other and UNDER other stuff, and pulled in and out of a loaded vehicle multiple times a day (or just slightly opened on one side since the hinges on both sides make quick access so easy). No spinning the bin around to the other side and you can still take the lid completely off if you want. I was not gentle with them after the first few days and they held up great. I'm only 5'5" and they were big enough to hold a TON but small enough for me to toss around. I was surprised how light they felt despite being completely full. The handles are wide and deep enough to never lose your grip. I appreciate the gaskets in the lid, too.  We were in some grubby settings and the bins kept the dirt and wet out. I also had some spicy stuff in one and you could only smell it when the lid was off. Not trying to claim they are scent-proof because I know they can't be. I bought these when I was struggling to find kitchen/food bins that would hold a lot but fit in bear boxes. I already have a Gregory pack I love so I was willing to spend the money to try these. SO GLAD I did. They are definitely my new camp/road trip kitchen boxes and I recommend them without reservation. Thank you Gregory and well done!!
review.name: Just buy the bins!!
comment: We like long, spicy, grubby trips too.  Thanks for taking us on your 7K adventure.

review.reviewBody: I’ve only used it once but I think it’s great and very durable. The lid is shatter proof and it has a lifetime warranty so it’s a good deal for something I will use a lot.
review.name: It’s great.

review.reviewBody: I ordered four to be able to take supplies to an island in Maine Monhegan Island and they were watertight and easily sealed. I love the way they open easily on one side and hinge on the other side if you want and the lid is tolerant over stuffing so slightly. Wonderful invention.
review.name: Always a use

review.reviewBody: Great product and love the see through lid. I love that it has a place for a lock if needed. Very durable!
review.name: Awesome features

review.reviewBody: Awesome box. It’s perfect for food storage while car camping. We love it. Actually I own two of them.
review.name: Food box

review.reviewBody: Heavy duty and looks great. I’ve used for a number of things in my garage and it’s perfect for all of my needs. Very well designed and high quality.
review.name: Amazing container for any storage needs

review.reviewBody: Storage!  Needed this for extra storage and works very well, aware it will also be great for hauling gear next time I go camping.
review.name: Storage!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like that the box is hard plastic and thay the lid is a bit see though. It makes looking for what you may need easier to find. I like that It has the latches to lock the lid down and a place to pit a lock if needed. My only concern is how durable the lid would be under impact. I do think this is super nifty to store our camping gear and hope we get a lot of life out of it!.
review.name: Great for camping gear

review.reviewBody: Much better mouse trap. I’ve used those flimsy rubber made totes a million times for camping and road trips but this is a much improved version. The stacking ability is nice but the ability to run a tie down through the small port on side makes your stack very stable, you could easily make a big pile of these boxes in the back of a side by side or in a roof cargo box. The hinge design is very clever and allows it to be opened from either side with one set of hinges still closed. The clear lid makes it easy to see what’s in box and feels very durable. Best of all the whole thing is air tight, the seal is legit, not just a length of foam tape but a full thick silicone bead. While it’s not a pelican style case it’s really not that far off so for the money the alpaca is a no brainer for me. Definitely checks all the “boxes”😉, I love it and would recommend these to anyone especially hunters, car campers and people who do a lot of rafting.
review.name: Awesome!!!

review.reviewBody: A lot of my outdoor gear has been loose in the garage, getting dusty and at it can be hard to find what I need. This gear box is great because it has helped me get organized, with backpack stove, filter, hammocks, knives, headlamps, etc., all in one place. Plenty of room and the transparent lid makes it easy to find what I need.
review.name: Durable and dust free

name: Alpaca Gear Box 45L

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Coda 10/20 Endless Promise Sleeping Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a warm and cozy bag.  

I have the regular size that feels long to me cause I'm 5'6", but I could not justify trying to fit into a short.  That aside, many bags leave space that your body has to fill with warmth before the bag starts to warm up...As bags get older, they have a harder time trying to maintain warmth cause the down begins to flatten or thin, leaving more airspace. This air space gets cold and the sleeper needs to wear some more clothes or fill the space with stuff so that the sleeper does not have to fill the bag with its own heat.  This latter thing has happened to me. My old bag, which was a 17-30 degree bag is now a 25-40 degree bag. It's old even though I love it.

Soooo. This bag takes away that problem by seemingly filling the empty spaces. It's not tight, it's just soft and cozy.  So you do not feel restricted at all.  The gills, I can't comment on yet. On this bag, there is only one gill. And the internal zipper tends to be "present". 

I wish the zipper to get in and out were a little longer so it was easier to ... get in and out. the hood is a little tighter than I would like. And at 2lbs 9 ounces, it's a little heavy.

The foot box zipper isn't that helpful unless you are in warmer weather.  But I wear EE booties, so my feet don't sweat.

I have a single-wall tent, so there is usually (not always) some condensation on the tent's inner walls, I appreciate the special fabric around the foot box and at the top of the hood to keep them dry.

Make no mistake this is designed to be a warm bag. and that is what it is. cozy and warm, without the need for stuffing or extra clothes.  I would not take this bag in temperatures 50 or above.  You get in, get warm, and go to sleep. 

Note: as part of the review, I am required to say whether I would recommend it or not.  I find this bag, a situational bag, I would recommend it for shoulder seasons.  But I don't feel like it's a three season bag.  And it has just enough going against it (the gill zipper, ingress/egress, etc.) that I can't recommend it. But I do like it.
review.name: cozy

review.reviewBody: If you want to a top notch bag this delivers. For a mummy bag, the long fits me really well at 6’3 with enough shoulder width to be surprisingly comfortable. Excellent build quality. Love the waterproof head and foot box and the thermal gill in no joke when it’s warm. Can’t say enough good things
review.name: Incredible bag, thoughtful features

review.reviewBody:
Just got this bag and I'm stoked to be upgrading. the thermal gills work very well, and the full collar is great for keeping drafts of your neck. can't describe how much I love the zip at the bottom. 
The only complaint I have is that the advertised compressed volume differs from reality. I got the Long length and the spec sheet says it should compress to 6L. I was barely able to get it into a 10L stuff sack. Maybe you can get it to 6 with an industrial vacuum chamber, but no chance in the field. Love everything else though!
review.name: Great sleeping bag with tons of clever features!

name: Coda 10/20 Endless Promise Sleeping Bag

Even when I stopped completely running and tried drinking from it it was collapsing on me and had a really terrible odor making the water taste weird even after I tried washing it three times.  Cheaply made and is probably leaching chemicals into whatever you’re drinking

comment:
As a leading provider of performance hydration, any issue with our product is taken seriously. Our products are made from a food-grade Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) material. We have used this material since 2001 and it is used by many of our competitors. It is the industry standard because of its food-safe properties and its durability.

TPU is safe, reliable and non toxic. It’s 100% BPA and PVC free: every one of our products meets or exceeds the most rigorous national food safety standards in the world. Unfortunately, a small percentage of flask and reservoir users can experience an unpleasant taste, which varies from person to person.

Please send us a message if you have any questions or concerns: info@hydrapak.com

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I needed for a race! Finger hook is very helpful, cup smashes flat, easy to stuff in a pocket.
review.name: It’s a cup

review.reviewBody: I really like using this cup… I take it with me everywhere I go

review.reviewBody: Love these glasses. I Snowboard, Bike, Hike and just was in the Mountains and on an Alaskan Cruise. They fit so well and my prescription was best I've seen in some time. Love the fit under my bike helmet they go great with my Smith Bike Helmet. I will order all prescription glasses in the future with Smith.
review.name: Fantastic Fit and Prescription

review.reviewBody: I was in the market for a really good pair of sunglasses and I knew Smith was a good name. These sunglasses are stylish and provide excellent clarity.
review.name: Great Clarity

review.reviewBody: Nice glasses, comfortable and feel high quality. Great sun protection for the eyes and the view through the lenses is very nice with a brown tint. About a week after I got them I noticed one of the logo letters was missing. Three weeks after I got them more letters are missing. This was yesterday so will see how this goes. Perhaps it is a glue defect, it's only happened on one side.
review.name: Smith sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Yet another great pair of non prescription sun glasses by Smith. Fit perfectly, great optics, and nice touch having the custom fitted 'around the neck holder'
review.name: Thanks again Smith

review.reviewBody: I would say I have a pretty average girl size face and these fit perfect. I don’t have the same problem as other reviewer with glasses leaving indent on face between eyes. I have the opal fade and love that they aren’t too dark. I hate when you have glasses on and it gets cloudy and then you can’t see. I don’t have this problem.
review.name: Love These!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these glasses to replace a pair of similar Smith sunglasses. The Tortoise/ChromaPop Polarized Brown lens is see through and feels like it doesn't filter out enough light. The glasses feel sticky on my nose which I have never experienced from Smith before.
review.name: Not the best from Smith

review.reviewBody: I have had several pairs of Smith sunglasses, but these are by far my favorite. Being able to see fish, sandbars, and have adequate sun protection on the water is so very important, and these are fantastic.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I’m only giving these a three because Smith used to be my go to for shades because they had a lot of non polarized lenses. Why non polarized? Because electronic screens and polarized lenses do not play well. Try driving a modern car or motorcycle with these and you will only see half the displays. Heads up displays are the greatest invention in modern cars but you can’t see them with polarized lenses. Check your navigation system and wonder why the display is dark. It’s your polarized lens. Can’t see your phone. It’s your polarized lenses. I seriously have ten pairs of smith glasses and this and another are the only polarized lenses and I never grab them. And if I do, I am immediately disappointed by how they mask out all my electronic devices. Please Smith bring back your non polarized lenses and let people know why they don’t want them. Help the world see the light. You have the power. Use it for the good of mankind
review.name: I’m only giving these a

review.reviewBody: Pictures on the website seem slightly different from what I got, but nonetheless I’m happy with them, clarity on the water is amazing.
review.name: Pictures on the website seem

review.reviewBody: It isn’t easy to choose sunglasses without trying them on. The description is spot on. I have a smaller face and the Rockaways fit great. I love the lens and the frame is very stylish too. I’ve worn them in Alaska and in Iceland and couldn’t be happier with their performance
review.name: Spot in Sunglasses

name: Rockaway ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

hasVariant.description: Buy the Goal Zero Boulder 50 Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This panel is well built. Would like to purchase a carrying case but doesn't appear to be an option. Power rating is overstated by at least 25%.  Even with the MPPT module, clear day, 75 F,  50 degree sun angle the maximum output is 36 watts.  If GoalZero support wants to reach out and let me know how to improve the output, I am open to suggestions.
I have the same issue with the 100 watt panel.
review.name: Well Built - Power Rating is Overstated

review.reviewBody: When kept in the bag with another bolder 50 it is a decent value and easily transported for car xampung
review.name: Valueoriented

review.reviewBody: The boulder 50 cones with cables to chain multiple panels in serial. Be warned that if you do this,  as i did with 2 panels,  the second panel only adds 5 to 10 watts of charging power. This was verified by  a GZ tech who said " that is all you should expect." Apparently you need the 8mm combiner cable to connect in parallel to get better performance. It doesn't state this anywhere on the product description for the panel.
review.name: Warning if wanting to chain multiple panels

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased a Yeti 150, Boulder 50, 2 sets of brackets, and a 15' 8mm extension cord, all to use in my truck camper. I got my order within a short time and in good condition. Love the Yeti 150, especially since our two day power outage this week. I had power to keep phones, tablets, and lights running with no problem. Looking forward to being off grid traveling on short trips soon. Very happy with the product and the ease of installing the panels on my truck camper.
review.name: Yeti 150

review.reviewBody: I set the panel on my deck railing, facing south. The panel generated between 20 and 25 watts per hour.worked well with my Yeti 500.
review.name: Boulder 50 with Yeti 500, South Dakota.

review.reviewBody: I love my Boulder 50 Solar Panel! It pairs well with my Yeti 500X power bank. I use it just to charge different devices (phones, speakers, computers, headphones) and it provides just enough power to do that!
review.name: Love my Boulder 50!

review.reviewBody: I love the Boulder 50 solar panel. It easily connects to my yeti 150 and powers it in a very short time.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: It does a terrific job of recharging my Goal Zero 150 power bank!
review.name: Boulder 150 Solar Panel

review.reviewBody: This panel is an excellent piece of hardware. Lightweight. Sturdy. Durable. I am absolutely in love with the tempered glass on the front. Mine has been through a Summer in North Alabama which includes hot, pollen, rain, wind, and even some bird droppings. It still works wonderfully. I do need to clean it a few times a month to keep it in good shape. Still, I believe it would operate under more negligence. I intend on buying another. I did buy the Boulder 100 Briefcase. Also incredible.
review.name: Excellent Piece of Hardware

review.reviewBody: Never had issues, and it's perfect for overlanding or living on the road!
review.name: Perfect for living on the road

name: Boulder 50 Solar Panel

review.reviewBody: These shorts are near perfect. Super lightweight, quick drying, fit is perfect. I like to run with compression shorts under these shells, and use different types of compression depending on the run, etc., so I much prefer the shell only short over a 2-in-1 short. I'm 6-ft 1 inch (186 cm) tall, and weigh 165 pounds (75 kg) and the Medium is a perfect fit. Waist feels snug, while not overly tight.
review.name: A new favorite!

review.reviewBody: Good shorts overall but only one gel pocket at back isnt enough ! Also on slim fit type which wasn’t an issue for me - but add side pockets pls salomon
review.name: Need side pockets

review.reviewBody:
Okay… but really! This is the glove of all gloves!

Everyone knows mittens are superior in regards to warmth. However dexterity is seriously lacking. Flylow figured out the sauce and brought us the mainline! I totally love it! Strapping into my bindings. Easy. Warm fingers. Heck yes. Finger guns. No problem. 

The nikwax is key! You must bake and treat these before you use them! Do it and they’ll last forevaaaa. I will seriously buy no other glove! They sizes vary a bit. Sometimes I’m a small sometimes a medium. And I have no issue with returns for the right size!
review.name: Happy Trigger Fingers!!!

review.reviewBody: It was the right size it fitted well and its so warm, best coat ever i swear
review.name: I would buy this product over and over

review.reviewBody: This jacket is very insulating and is the perfect thickness for moving around but not feeling too constricted.
review.name: Well-Made!

review.reviewBody: This coat is super comfortable and looks good, I like it for those reasons. Sadly it does not have interior pockets! Inexcusable! The pockets are lined on only one side (the outside), so the inside side of the pockets is the same water resistant material the coat is made of, which means your hands will get wet and sweaty fast. The hood falls off very easily, with or without a beanie on it just doesn't stay up, walking into the wind it literally is useless. This coat is very comfortable, it is light and the material is super flexible, but the glaring design errors are unacceptable at this price point and surprising from a good brand like the north face. Probably best to find a different coat that would be more useful. I feel good in this coat down to about 50-55 degrees depending on the wind
review.name: Love this coat, but it is ridiculously poorly designed

review.reviewBody: Love,  love,  love these boots!  They a re comfortable right out of.the box,  yet sturdy and supportive.   My feet are slightly narrow, but these fit without any issues, no blisters or rubbing.  Shoe is very stylish as well.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Wore these boots for the first time on a 6 mile hike with a three thousand foot elevation gain in Colorado. Very rocky and uneven trails. Absolutely no blisters, no problems and great protection from feeling the rocks through the bottoms of my shoes (which was why I bought these instead of wearing my usual La Sportiva Mountain Hiking shoes, which I love, but which were just not up to so many sharp rocks everywhere). Great ankle support, make sure they are laced up tight enough so that you have as little movement as possible (without cutting off your circulation lol). I wear a size 6.5 - 7 Euro size 38, wore a fairly thin Pro Compression sock, weather was in the mid 60s. Other boots I have and love are the classic leather Vasques (have had over ten years) and Zamberlan.
review.name: These boots are great

description: Buy the Silca Pista Plus Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pista Plus Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Pista Plus Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The base-model Pista is amazing for its simplicity.  You can buy replacement parts for all of the consumables here, and the rest of it will just last forever.  (Actually my 1980 Pista finally rusted out, so there is a limit.)  To me, it says a lot that the replacement pump chuck is indicated to fit Silca pumps made "from 1949 to present."  Note that the pump chuck fits on the stem by just jamming a tight rubber gasket over the stem--no levers, threads, or other complexity.  It works really well and couldn't be more simple, but to get it off, the best way is to turn the stem to the top of the wheel, grip the tire from both sides with your fingers and use your thumb to push the chuck off the stem.  My wife absolutely cannot do this, it turns out that simplicity requires larger hands and some hand strength.
review.name: Simple perfection

name: Pista Plus Floor Pump

hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Synergetic Chain Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I picked up Road Cycling for two and half years and have been trying new chain lube every six months. Mac-off Lube (dry) and Mac-off Ceramic (Dry) were my go to lube, and they were great lube (no complain). But this Silca Synergetic Chain Lube is on the next level of chain lube, by far the best lube I have ever used. Just a tiny drop on each link, last a long time, very easy to clean and very quite. Sure get what you paid for, won't use anything else.
review.name: Synergetic is simply best.

name: Synergetic Chain Lube

review.reviewBody: I was hopeful these would become my favorite shoe of all time, but they are a disappointment. Possibly one of the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever owned. While I still look at them and adore them, these shoes probably won’t make it out too often due to how uncomfortable they are to walk in.
review.name: What a bummer

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable I bought a second pair long before the first pair have worn out. I wear one pair of the other everyday.
review.name: 2nd pair

review.reviewBody: Love the comfortableness of my new shoes and actually loving its style now.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: First, the color is awesome. Even more gorgeous in person. Second, these are very comfortable and easy to wear. Because they lace up the whole foot, they easily accommodate my high arch. (
review.name: Comfortable and fun

review.reviewBody: I have sore feet often because of bunions. I have found these to be wide in just the right areas. I did size up as suggested.
review.name: Perfect fit for bunion feet!

review.reviewBody: I loove theeese, they look cool and they let my feet spread out. They’re the ideal adventure shoe for me so far. I like how sturdy they are but when im walking across rocks i can definitely activate my toes. The only thing is, i usually wear an 8 but had to downsize to 7.5.
review.name: Suuper comfy sturdy yet soft shoes

review.reviewBody:
Like the look. Maybe should have gotten size 7.5
Usually wear size 8. Very comfortable.
review.name: Like the look. Maybe should

review.reviewBody: After buying these shoes. I will never go back to any other shoe ever. Keens are my favorite brand ever!
review.name: Best shoes ever!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I liked the look and feel of the shoe but the toe area was narrow. Ordering was easy. Delivery was fast. And returning was simple.
review.name: Small in the toe area

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. They are comfortable and work for varying terrain and look so cool and swaggy. I've gotten a lot of comments on them :)
review.name: Cool and Comfy

review.reviewBody: I am an east coast avid Splitboarder, this board will make you feel so much faster, it is lightweight and easy to maneuver without losing any fun on the downs. It’s super flexy but still stable and holds a great edge. I ride small board to maneuver tight trees. So don’t be alarmed if you see the size to height ratio. I also ride a 146 as a daily driver at the resort. This works with my style of riding.
review.name: East Coast Rider review

review.reviewBody: I love the Weston Rise splitboard! Although I have other splitboards, I find myself reaching for the Rise more often than not because of it ability to shred in all conditions and a variety of terrain. I take this thing in tight trees, big steep bowls, cliff drops and backcountry booters. I know this board is marketed toward women, but as a smaller dude I love having a board that fits my body without sacrificing its ability to charge.
review.name: Great All-Mountain Splitboard

name: Rise Splitboard - 2025 - Women's

hasVariant.name: 105 PD-R7000 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano 105 PD-R7000 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just not as light as Ultegra but work as well and will probably last longer
review.name: Work fine

review.reviewBody: My last set of 105 pedals lasted 12 years, they were metal instead of composite. These are much lighter, hope they last just as long!
review.name: Nice upgrade to my last 105 pedals

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these last year with my new road bike to replace the very old Speedplay lollipops I had on my old bike and am overall very happy with these.  The pedals seem basically bulletproof and can be serviced with new grease (although the custom tool needed to do this is a bit annoying)

Pros:  durablity, large platform, adjustability with both tension and float (with different cleats)
Cons: while the pedals are durable, the cleats are much less so and could be made of some tougher material.  Not as easy to engage as Speedplay

Overall they're better than my Speedplays for 2 main reasons. First is that the larger platform is more comfortable and stable as my feet would occasionally be sore after long or hard rides.  Second is the design of the Speedplay cleats puts the screw heads in direct contact with the ground so after any amount of walking on pavement you'll end up having challenges to remove the cleat from your shoes.  Fighting to get the cleats off with rounded off heads is no fun.
review.name: Great Pedals

review.reviewBody: This is my first time using clip-in peddles. They are awesome and hold up well to the beating I put them through on eat ride.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Great pedals. Had a tough time deciding as it was my first time migrating to clip-ins, but these are the real deal. Would buy again- highly recommend.
review.name: Outstanding Pedals

name: 105 PD-R7000 Pedals

review.reviewBody: A little too sweet for my tastes so I just use one "heaping" scoop, rather than the recommended two. I might be compromising on the effectiveness of the product by decreasing but so far I haven't noticed anything detrimental. I was using the Skratch labs Hydration product, and for the most part, I like it. But price per serving, the Gnarly is about 25% less cost so I'll give this a try for a little while.
review.name: A little too sweet for my tastes

review.reviewBody: I've been using this electrolyte mix for years and I've tried many other popular brands. The Orange Pineapple is my favorite flavor though all are great. The reason I like this one is because it's low in sugar. 9/10 times I don't need added sugar for fueling, electrolytes do just fine. The product tastes AMAZING and has a perfect ratio of sodium/potassium/magnesium that the typical athlete loses during high-output or hot activity. My only complaint is it doesn't come in a bigger package - this is the type of product I'd buy in bulk at Costco. Also, from a brand perspective, Gnarly is on their A-game when it comes to sustainability and putting their money into conservation, especially locally here in Utah.
review.name: BEST Electrolyte Mix

name: Hydrate

review.reviewBody: The Platypus QuickDraw Microfilter System is a must when going into the backcountry. One of the standout features of this system is its impressive flow rate. I was able to fill up mine and my partners soft flasks in no time using the filter. It also helped having a large bladder bag so I was able to fill multiple flasks per bladder. I was also a fan of how small the bag and filter packed down into. This made it super easy to throw in my vest on those longer adventures. The only downside of the bag I had was sometimes filling up the bladder was a little difficult since it didn't have much structure to open it up. With that said, the QuickDraw filter itself is able to attach directly to your standard water bottle top so you don't need the bladder bag if you don't want to carry it.
review.name: No reason to not filter your water!

name: QuickDraw Microfilter System

review.reviewBody: About 40 days into wearing these (very lightly) they started falling apart: frayed fabric, rubber soles coming off, could see my sock. I asked for a refund but Backcountry did not budge. They finally agreed that all they would do is send me a duplicate pair. I’m not 40 days into the duplicate pair and facing the same exact issues. For the price, I would expect this product to be better made. I’ll be calling them for, I suppose, a third pair and will likely continue this until I just get my money back.
review.name: Only last a month

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great shoe for walking around and taking a stroll along the beach. They are very comfortable and are of good quality. It is a great item to take on vacation. I find them to be a good shoe for someone who likes to walk around alot.
review.name: Nice shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this and they wear well and are a great fit . They are leather and they don’t wrinkle up after wear and they are so soft and comfortable. They are a great pair shoes to wear hiking fishing and camping.
review.name: Wear well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Olukai Mens Mio Li shoes are the perfect casual sneaker! They are a mix of sporty meets casual. The style is modern with leather accents. The shoe is comfortable throughout your entire day. They are sturdy but not heavy. They even have a year warranty! The shoe is full of numerous natural textures and patterns which is unique. I would highly recommend these shoes to anyone due to the comfort and design!
review.name: Comfy shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband was very happy when he received these shoes, he's very picky but he was very satisfied with the comfort and lightweight of these shoes. He used it during casual or active. Very well made and as a family that lives in Hawaii before, this brand captured our attentions. The quality,material and craftmanship is amazing. Highly recommended!
review.name: Very Well Made Shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These neat looking shoes were so comfortable to wear. They were light weight which as a person who has leg/back problems I loved. It didn’t feel heavy on my foot. I felt like they were breathable as well.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] OluKai - Mio Li sneakers are pretty nice looking and also lightweight. They are very nice to wear in the summertime. I like the look of them. They are a bit unique looking and made well. I haven’t worn them for a long period yet but they have felt very comfortable. I would like to have them on my next sightseeing trip. I think I’ll get much use out of these shoes.
review.name: Nice lightweight sneaker

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these shoes for my husband, and he absolutely loves them. They’re super comfortable and such great quality. The fit him perfectly and wears them all the time now! Will definitely be getting different pairs for him!
review.name: So nice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable shoes I am so happy with the pattern of the shares and the souls everything is comfortable so nice to walk in really like this product issues are very comfortable on my feet and I will choose to purchase more in the future
review.name: Comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are a great fit and very comfortable and wife loves them she took them and made them her own, had plenty room all around and gave her the ability to walk without hurting like some shoes do you be glad you got them
review.name: Great Look

review.reviewBody: WOW these are fantastic for small hands! I wanted them because I wanted something that had some grip, but wasn't bulky . . . . But fit well it's very very hard for me with my short small fingers and small hands to find gloves just to wear generally in winter. These fit perfectly! They are snug, I ordered small, but I know they will stretch to be a bit more comfortable. Very happy with these.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: When ascending into rocky terrain my hands stay well gripped to the rocks. No more abrasions, or microabrasions to hands
review.name: When ascending into rocky terrain

review.reviewBody: Love these gloves. Had a pair for years and after some intense rescue rigging practice, finally wore some holes in them. So glad to have a new pair of these trusty gloves for the next several years!
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody: I was surprised how small the medium size was and I took them to a store to try the large but they were out of stock. I will now will send back and see if women's large is large enough
review.name: gloves - size

review.reviewBody: The spacing for the fingers are mighty tight compared to same sizing in other BD glove products. And the stitching over the knuckles significantly reduces fabric stretch. I’d steer people to a different glove. BD generally rocks it - but not this model.
review.name: Tight

review.reviewBody: Why do these run so dang small? Not even close on sizing. Bumm deal.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, 3 stars as they fit small. Size up 1. The women's small is very snug, so went up to a women's medium.
review.name: Belay gloves

review.reviewBody: I’m on my second pair of the Crag Gloves after wearing my first to the point of absolute shredding (which took a few years). I rather sacrifice my skin to the rock than the rope so the Crag Gloves are an absolute must for me. Comfortable and breathable - they do start off a little tight but break in nicely. I might recommend sizing up if this is a concern. The measurements dictated I should order a Medium and for the first couple of uses they were tight enough to be uncomfortable and required a break in period. I might also recommend considering the men’s version if you want a little more space. Like I mentioned, these lasted me a few years climbing ropes 3-4 days a week and absolutely save my skin, making me a better belay.
review.name: A staple

review.reviewBody: The quality seems great, but the gloves are much too small. Consider sizing up.
review.name: Nice but too small

review.reviewBody: I can’t use these at all but it’s not worth trying to do a return. But these gloves are too small and I even ordered a size up based on other reviews saying they were small. However I should have ordered two sizes bigger.
review.name: Way too small

name: Crag Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: It's a nice jersey but the fit was not right for me. The fit through the torso was odd - it was tight up top, but loosened at the bottom, and there didn't seem to be any elastic at the bottom to hold it close to your body, it just flapped around. This made me return it.
review.name: Well made but bad fit

review.reviewBody: Disclaimer: ?chilly? in southern california is high 50s in the morning.  This jersey is warm enough with just a light tech tee underneath, and wind proof enough to keep me warm.  I love the high vis color for safety too.  I?m 5?8? and 145lbs, a medium fits me perfectly.  (I?m typically a slim small in most brands.)
review.name: Great for chilly mornings

review.reviewBody: Nice looking and well fitting cycling jersey that keeps me warm during my rides. I would highly recommend it. Very well made. Love the small zippered pocket .
review.name: Keeps me warm

review.reviewBody: TTS.  Used in 40F with quite a headwind and kept me perfect temp.  I usually do run a little hotter than others though.  Would recommend.
review.name: Good Value.

review.reviewBody: Took this out for its maiden voyage yesterday on an overcast 50 degree day. Kept my nice and warm the whole time and looked great doing it. It's very soft and handsome. The only thing I find odd is how long the sleeves are. They cover my hands completely! I have an Apple Watch to monitor my heart rate and I had to roll up (fold back) about 6" of the sleeve to be able to see the watch. Not a major flaw but I do wonder why they made them so long.
review.name: Great piece

name: Attack Thermal Jersey - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like these better than the original Ghost.  I was having discomfort in both of my Achilles heels and my lower back.  Usually when this starts to happen its a sign that I need new shoes.  When I purchased these, the pain completely went away within a few days.  The improved cushioning is amazing.  I also think these are more stylish than the original Ghost.  If Brooks is going to continue this line, I plan to purchase these moving forward.  Definitely recommend.
review.name: Comfortable & Stylish

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a wide shoe and my god these things are so comfortable. I like the gray with the blue. Shipped to an APO too which I always appreciate.
review.name: Nothing to complain about, super comfy

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not much support, definitely lacking in cushion, feels narrow, rubbing my baby toe. Gonna have to switch these and stick to the superior reliable fit and comfort of the Glycerine.
review.name: disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe is great I love it. The main point of this review is your company. During the Christmas rush FedEx lost the order for a while. I contacted you and the person, yes an actual person, could not have been nicer or more helpful resolving the problem. They made your company really stand out. I am so glad the actual shoe I also great as I plan on being a Brooks customer for a long time.
review.name: Great Shoe and Great Company

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My brother raves about these sneakers and how it provides so much comfort, so I decided to gift a pair to my boyfriend just in time for his family trip to Europe. Now my boyfriend raves about how comfortable these sneakers are. I may have to buy a pair for myself.
review.name: Rave

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable 
Nice design 
Either walking ,  or going for run  it’s a great fit 
And looks great also
review.name: Brooks ghost

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I found a pair of perfect shoes in the Dyad 11. Unfortunately those are discontinued. I've purchased the recommended Ghost Max, Ghost 16 and now Ghost Max 2. Each shoe gets further away from the Dyad 11. The shoe induces supination while the more significant heel drop makes one feel as though they have to roll over the mid foot and on to the fore foot. I sent them back.  Maybe the shoe is fine on its own, but it is the antithesis of the shoe it was recommended as a replacement for and going the wrong way.
review.name: The wrong direction

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My comments are about walking. The ghost max2 extra wide is comfortable and has a cushioned feeling. They feel great, I'm over 65 and these are very much appreciated. Thank you! Brooks
review.name: First Ghost max 2

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So different than the Dyad. Not sure if I like them yet

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far so good. Have had them for a couple weeks now and my foot pain I was experiencing with the Adidas shoes is gone. They’re very supportive. Will probably be first of many Brooks running shoes for me. Mostly worn for work and walking.
review.name: Great shoes. No more foot pain.

name: Ghost Max 2 Wide Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The length and weight are fantastic for boarding. I was in 10-30 degrees (mostly sunny and little wind) for 6 days on the slopes and had no complaints whatsoever. If I got warm, the vents were nice and opening up the front was simple with gloves. A ton of perfectly placed pockets for passes, money, goggles, and phones so they aren't in your way and also not on your mind for getting lost. The fit was a touch loose but was there for layering if needed. The snow skirt and wrist snow protection were amazing! I never got any snow shot up the arms or waist. I would definitely buy this again.
review.name: Perfect Jacket

name: Juniper 3.0 Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great fit and I get compliments all the time on the vibrant colors it has.
review.name: Awesome hat

review.reviewBody: This hat is so cool…literally and figuratively. Cool art vintage look meets great airflow in the classic mesh style. Adjustable. We have other hiking hats from Sunday afternoons, in a totally different deferent style, that are the BEST out there. Love this company. We recommend highly!
review.name: Superb in every way

review.reviewBody: Killer art and s cool cross between a trucker and a cap. Lifetime Guarantee? Love it.
review.name: Cool hats!

review.reviewBody: Really cool design and comfortable fit. Wearing art is awesome.
review.name: Cool hat and comfy

review.reviewBody: I received this Artist Series Everest Trucker Hat as a holiday gift and I love it! Great fit, comfortable and high quality. Plus it has a lifetime warranty! Looks great and have received many complements. You will also love it!!
review.name: Awesome Trucker Hat!

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. Super comfy and colorful. Wish the logo was a little smaller, but other than that, it’s great.
review.name: Can’t beat Yosemite.

review.reviewBody: This is a cute hat and matches with most everything in my hiking closet. Easy snap back, although my tiny head meant that the snaps overlap the hat at the back. Decent quality and I like the design.
review.name: Cute design

review.reviewBody: My husband bought me this hat & one other, love them! Ready to replace it as it's gotten  worn out & dirty. I love that it has SPF material! 😎👍
review.name: Comfortable & Great colors!

review.reviewBody: I've bought a couple of the artist series. The fit and feel are above average, and a good way to profile artists.
review.name: Cool series of trucker caps

review.reviewBody: I love this hat. It's soft, flexible and super comfy. I've been complimented so many times on the design, so a huge "hats off" to the designer!
review.name: Hats off to the designer!

review.reviewBody: Broken plastic cover ends after the 1 day of backpacking, very annoying problem while you are out camping for 4 days. I will be returning this chair if backcountry doesn't offer solution.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody:
Quite light but also sturdy and comfortable. Enjoyed some coffee staring at a gorgeous sunrise and it did me wonders. Also so easy to set up and kind of satisfying while it self assembles as you twist it.

My one reservation is that it takes up a little bit more room than it needs to I think. Not a lot, I was able to take it backpacking, but a little chunky.
review.name: Killer
comment: Thanks for the great review Evan! The Joey is definitely a little bulkier than some of the smaller/lighter chairs out there like the Helinox Chair One; but for the price it just can't be beat!

review.reviewBody: The chair packs small enough to take on bikecamping trips. It's easy to set up and put away. Used it once at the beach and worked well. The chair was stable and comfortable.  I'm 5'3" and 120.
review.name: The right size

review.reviewBody: I wanted to really like this chair. I got this chair because of the price point. I used it for a few camping trips and after a few trips it started to rip, (both chairs I got). I would say you get a good deal with the price point with these chairs but they won't last forever. If you are looking to get a tougher lightweight chair i would get a Helinox chair.
review.name: Fell apart after a few uses

review.reviewBody: Finally, a helmet that fits perfectly! It's comfortable, lightweight, and breathable. It is low profile without compromising coverage. I love the matte color block. Would recommend this mountain biking helmet.
review.name: Amazing helmet

review.reviewBody: I crashed really hard today. Lost it on a large jump, hit the ground and my head. Broke my glasses and cracked my helmet. I feel like I’ve been hit by a car but thankfully, my head feels great. I’m grateful for MIPS today and I have ordered another Session helmet.
review.name: Crash Tested

review.reviewBody: I never got around to reviewing my session but since I'll be getting a new helmet I guess I'll do it. Ive had this helmet for 3 seasons and it has served me well but unfortunately I biffed hard last week and I'll be needing a replacement. No concussion though, thanks to koroyd, mips, and smith. Yeehaw.
review.name: No concussion, no problem

review.reviewBody: Two things: The liner padding so thinned out after 20 or so rides that the helmet now digs into. my forehead. And around the nape of your neck, the fitment system has zero padding. The plastic "pads" grab your skin and it's not comfy from day 1. By the end of a long ride, I couldn't stand how this helmet felt, especially if I was sweaty. Bummer.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Incredibly lightweight but sturdy helmet that can be easily adjusted! The whole family loves them and it is great that there are several designs to choose from.
review.name: Great for the Whole Family

review.reviewBody: Let me begin by saying that I have worn Smith sunglasses for several decades and love them. Due to this I decided to try a Smith Helmet. Still working on the fit. Helmet drops down and obscures my field of vision, I've tried every adjustment I can. Also, the sunglasses retainer doesn't work without destroying the ear pads on your glasses due to the honeycomb liner.
review.name: The verdict is still out

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and love the design and the color. I always buy Smith because of their lifetime warranty. My measured head circumference was in between the small and the medium so I bought both to send one back and definitely needed the medium size.
review.name: Great Design!

review.reviewBody: Decent helmet, the fit is nice, feels great while I ride but it’s lacking any convenient place to put my sunglasses which is very annoying during a ride
review.name: Good but lacks sunglasses holder

review.reviewBody: This helmet didn’t fit. I received it as a gift for Christmas and when I tried to return it, the company would not allow it since it had been past 30 days. That’s not much time for returns after the holidays!
review.name: This helmet didn’t fit. I

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and lightweight Helmet. Highly recommend. Also looks amazing!!
review.name: Highly recommend this helmet!

name: Session Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Excellent product but I have a hard time rotating and pushing down the binding when moving from ski to walk or reverse. I have small hands and when cold I find the switch harder than average. Practice at home before heading out.
review.name: Great binding but tough on cold hands

review.reviewBody: I like the rotations, their versatility, for on and off, piste, and their reliable functionality. However, I’m not 100% sold on them due to the weight and the FACT that they collect snow and ice under the heel when touring. If you want a quiver of one ski binding, this might be it. But if you primarily tour, there are better options.
review.name: Rotations

review.reviewBody: Great bindings that allow for a safer knee release while touring, but provide light weight uphills and sturdy aggressive downhills. I loved them so much i got two pairs one for my powder touring and my all mountain touring skis!
I've used Dynafit touring bindings for several years now and they do not disappoint. These ST Rotation are great on the uphill and downhill and have a great release if your in trouble.
review.name: Great Touring Binding

review.reviewBody: Hard to operate very stiff Fromm walk modes. Trying to work in like a baseball mitt or hiking boot.
review.name: Very stiff. Hard to operate

review.reviewBody: I just mounted my rotations on a set of free 107s. I’ve only skied two days on them. One in the backcountry, one in the resort to see how they hold up on variable snow. So far, very pleased with both uphill and downhill performance
review.name: So far, awesome.

review.reviewBody: I've been skiing on these bindings for the past 4+ seasons, mostly backcountry in the White Mountains of NH, with terrain ranging from mellow trails to "do not fall" gullies, and a couple resort days here and there. While they are on the heavier side of touring bindings (to be expected given the features), I've found them to be really solid up and down: no issues and no unexpected releases.

Works really well for more descent based touring. Trust these way more than the really light Dynafits and so far have never pre-released like I do from the lighter ones occasionally.  They are heavier, but when skiing either deeper backcountry pow or a tight icy chute know these are certified on the release is very important and allows me to not lock out the toes which is also a bonus since if I'm in a big crash or avalanche I do not want these still connected to me. My only complaint and I didn't take a star off is that getting into them with the movable toe is tough in deeper snow and getting them into tour mode on the heel takes some muscle compared to my other dynafits. Minor overall and completely recommend.

These are great beefy tech bindings that can handle anything you throw at them. I am a lighter skier, but I have never had any issues with release or power while mounted on Icelantic Shamans (110 underfoot BEEFY skis). The pivoting toe binding gives a little more peace of mind that the toe will release when you need it to and won't when you don't. They have a wide adjustable range and were able to accommodate a 2cm jump in boot sole length when I bought new boots. The risers are a breeze to flip up or down with your ski pole handle. Getting the brakes down while rotating the heel tower to go into tour mode isn't the easiest, but having brakes is a plus for riding in-bounds. I would buy lighter tech bindings for serious backcountry only ski set ups, but these bindings do well in or out of bounds and could be mounted on a quiver-killer do-it-all ski setup.
Work great, function well even in super cold conditions.

name: ST Rotation 10 Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: Not as pictured. The kids size hat comes with a thick white band around the bottom. The hat we received with the white band can be seen in the toddler size picture. The hummingbird part of the hat is super cute but even my 9 year old said she looked silly before I even said anything about it. Now I have to ship it back for a return.
