review.reviewBody: After a bike trip in the Netherlands, I came home looking for panniers like the ones that kept my stuff dry and protected through days of riding in wind and pouring rain. These were exactly like the ones on the tour and I like them just as much on my bike at home. They are the best!
review.name: Excellent panniers!

review.reviewBody: Used these on a recent 500m bike packing trip.  Great quality, easy to use.  2 on the rear fit just about all of my clothing, sleeping bag, pillow, and food.  If you are bike packing, consider the hi-viz models they offer.  My friend used those and I feel like it's a no brainer to choose them for extra safety.
review.name: Well built

review.reviewBody: Got it for my father-in-law and he is very pleased! The panniers can hold so much stuff, perfect for his grocery store commutes. The only thing is I wish they sold single panniers instead of the pair because one pannier is enough for him. They are also very easy to adjust and take on off, all you need to do is pull up on the handle!
review.name: Got for my father in law

review.reviewBody:
I've been using one of the Panniers for over a month with no issues. Very happy with the water tight seal. However, I started using the second one this week and the stitching snapped on the pull over strap with a very minimal pull to make it waterproof. The build quality is terrible on the strap with it breaking after < 30 minutes of use. I am still waiting on Ortlieb's response - not the fastest either. Pretty frustrating I can't use both right now when I need them for work. Not impressed 1 out of 2 has bad build quality with the price.

I will leave an update pending any response from Ortlieb
review.name: One Pannier Broke within 3 uses

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for running errands and ultimately to tour with in the future. It's nice being able to go grocery shopping with these knowing I can place up to 20 pounds in each pannier. They held up nicely in the rain while coming home from shopping. The inside of each pannier was completely dry. Each pannier can be customized to fit different rack sizes and has a hook you can use to keep your pannier from moving too much. Overall, these are top-notch panniers and I strongly recommend adding them to your biking family!
review.name: Amazing Panniers

name: Back-Roller Classic Panniers - Pair

hasVariant.name: 316 Series 150-Quart Chest Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman 316 Series 150-Quart Chest Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very big and spacious. Kept my frozen items sufficiently frozen. Happy with the performance and glad i bought them.
review.name: Cooler Function

review.reviewBody:
We bought a 316 Series 150-qt cooler to haul beef. It's been used twice to haul 1/4 cow over 700 miles and performed well both times. Depending on the size of the animal, it will hold a full quarter (or 1/2 of a 1/2). Both times we filled it full of frozen beef, made the drive, and the beef was still frozen solid (no ice added). 
When loaded, it is quite heavy, but the one time it was lifted from the ground to the truck while loaded, the handles were up to the task.
We also used it on a much longer trip, but then we were just keeping stuff cold (not frozen) and we added ice periodically. It will fit in the bed of a pickup with a few inches to spare. It will also fit in the back of a medium-sized SUV.
So, it's been used three times, and when not is use, I store it in the basement. I did notice this last time that the lid was warping. It would still seal when pushed down, but in reading some of the other reviews, this may be the start of a problem. Hope not. I gave it four stars based on the way it has performed so far. If the lid continues to warp, with so little used and being otherwise stored in a cool basement out of the sun, then you could knock off three stars.
review.name: Good, but...

review.reviewBody: The label in big blue and white letters states, “keeps ice for up to 6 days.”  We went camping and by the second day, 90% of the ice had melted. Cooler was not in the sun and didn’t get open often.
review.name: Doesn’t keep ice like it states
comment:
Hello.

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear that our cooler did not keep ice. We understand the importance of reliable cooling, especially for items that need to stay cold for extended periods. Your feedback is valuable to us as we continuously strive to improve our products and provide the best possible experience for our customers.

Your feedback is valuable to us and it will be forwarded to the appropriate department for further review.

Your Coleman 316 Series™150-Quart Hard Cooler has a 1- Year Limited Warranty, to initiate the warranty claim, please follow this link: https://www.coleman.com/on/demandware.store/Sites-coleman-Site/default/Support-EZWarranty?wstep=info.

If you require further assistance, please do not hesitate to get in touch with us directly.

Reach out to us via our website or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am - 5pm Eastern Time.

Thank you!
Coleman® Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Best cooler ever! This keeps everything i take to the farmers market cold with little ice. Didn't have to worry about anything thawing out.
review.name: Cooler

review.reviewBody: This is about as basic of a cooler as you can get. The lid is very cheap and the "cup holders" won't do much to keep a drink from staying in place or falling over. My small kids climbed on the lid on a single camping trip and the hinges were easily damaged.
review.name: Weak lid

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly with my camper. Fits on the back rack
review.name: Highly recommend it .works great for camping. Plus

review.reviewBody: We bought this cooler to use on our boat but before we could even take it out, the lid has warped and won't seal. I have pictures but the site won't let me load them.
review.name: Not worth the money
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman 316 Series™150-Quart Hard Cooler.I'm sorry to hear that the product did not meet your expectations owing to a problem with the warped lid, which caused the cooler to not seal properly.This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: Is the perfect size, happy to have it for party's.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought 15 of these for a fishing vessel, to replace the original all white hard shell 150qt coleman's. I regret that so much. The lids on these are soft and when it is hot outside on deck. They become so soft, the lids tend to curl up on the edges and sink in the middle, melting out all the ice on your fresh seafood. 
BRING BACK THE OG ORIGINALS COLEMAN!
review.name: Not as durable
comment:
Hi there,

We’re sorry to hear that the quality of this cooler didn’t meet your expectations. The company values and highly appreciates your comments, and we'll make sure that everyone knows about your suggestions.

If you have any additional queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose "contact us" from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the largest cooler I believe we have ever owned. We bought it to help move the food from a house to house when we are moving across country. The perks it kept everything cool for long periods of time and with the lid remaining closed the ice would last about 24 to 48 hours. 
Unfortunately you have to be careful about how much stuff you put in the cooler as it becomes very heavy very quickly and does not have wheels.
review.name: Large and in Charge

name: 316 Series 150-Quart Chest Cooler

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, fits great, no bunching or chaffing.  KISSAir2 and Giro4 leg grippers worked great…2 hour ride and no issues whatsoever.  Definitely size up.  I’m 5’8” with athletic glutes.  Normally wear size XL in U.S. sizing, ordered XXL in these and was a perfect fit around the waist and legs.  Will be ordering another pair or two.
review.name: Awesome Shorts

review.reviewBody: I read all the reviews that they fit small, so I ordered a large though I am technically a medium with waist 34”. They were still very snug (fit like a glove)  but once on the bike worked well. Have only worn them on 1 ride so far but I’d say they are very comfortable and look great.
review.name: Good quality shorts

review.reviewBody: I bought these partly because of that song. The description said the chamois was good for rides of any length. That's proving to be true: my workouts are 8-22 miles long and these shorts aare comfortable start to finish. I wore them for my first gravel race too. Next weekend I'll wear them on the long ride at the Tour de Vineyard in Palisade,CO.I like the lack of bib straps. They're very well made. They work well with leg sleeves, wether to block the sun or are warmth on cold mornings. The size chart needs no adjustments either. Mine are Twilight blue. I'm 6'4" and weigh 90 Kg: XXL fit great
review.name: A soulful shade of blue

review.reviewBody: I love Castelli cycling jerseys, great fabric, color and styles, but I learned they run small. I wear larges. Ordered large shorts and could barely squeeze into them. I I would size up two sizes if you normally wear a medium. Nice style with multi-colored panels.
review.name: Cycling shorts

review.reviewBody: Nice looking shorts and the material felt nice to the touch. But these shorts were too tight.  I wear a medium in all other cycling shorts except Castelli and I have to get a large.  But the large was still too tight.
review.name: Toooooo small

review.reviewBody: Stitching failed after a dozen rides or more. Been MTB for over 25 years and I typically wear Pearl Izumi or SQlab liners and never had stitching fail or get a hole so soon; especially considering the price of the Castelli shorts. The shorts fit good and padding is comfortable.  I will not likely purchase this product again.
review.name: Stitching Failed

review.reviewBody: Nice shorts but definately get a size up -- they run quite small.  They are super small when you take them out of the package, and while it gets better after you've worn it once or twice, there is no way i'd fit into what i usually get.  I'm a Med but get a Large with this.  But good shorts and good cushion if you size correctly
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: They seemed small at first look, but fit very well. Easily my most comfortable pair of biking shorts.
review.name: Excellent Biking Shorts

review.reviewBody:
Been looking for the perfect pair of cycle pants for sessions on the direct drive trainer - I spend hours riding and over 500 km a month.  I've tried a few different pairs but after completing 'The Competitive Cyclist for Kyle' challenge on Strava, I decided to have a look at the selection of gear compiled by the 'gear heads' like the late Kyle.

I was NOT disappointed!

These Castelli Shorts are like a second skin.  I'm 5'10" and 195lbs and chose large - when I first tried the shorts on they were a snug aero fit but after a couple of rides they were like a second skin.  These shorts are so functional but at the same time, the function is based on great design along with understated but very stylish motif.

As I walked down the hallway to the office where the trainer was set up, my wife just said "Wow!"  She immediately asked me if my new cycling gear was Italian which I replied in the affirmative - she was very impressed and provided a number of compliments about how good my new gear looked.  

She noted how much more stylish and flattering my new gear was compared to my old gear - noting the understated nature of the branding and stylish cut of the shorts and the Castelli sleeveless base layer I'd also purchased for the warm up phase.

Well done to Competitive Cyclist, thanks to the gear heads (and to the late Kyle) for curating cycling kit that works so well and looks good enough that my wife notices!
review.name: When you put them on & wife says wow!

review.reviewBody: Order up a size unless you wanna join the Vienna Boys' Choir.
review.name: Yes, sizing is off!

review.reviewBody: really great shoes in terms of comfort, unfortunately the back of the shoes completely detached from the sole on the back after only few months. kind of crazy, I just used them for walking.
review.name: not durable

review.reviewBody: I bought these because I’ve heard so many great things about OnCloud. Maybe I should have tried a version of their running shoes. I thought they were going to be the most comfortable shoes ever. They’re ok. Well made.
review.name: Ok

review.reviewBody: I have the same vortex models three season prior.  Was so happy with them I bought this newer version.  Dissatisfied with the sloppy feel and heel hold
review.name: Downgrade from previous version

review.reviewBody: Why even bother taking these off? They are like walking on clouds...lightweight, stylish, puddle/waterproof, perfect for travel, workout, running, walking, chilling, reading, you name it. Love these ON Cloud 5 shoes.
review.name: Sleek & snazzy

review.reviewBody: I didnt have the best expectations looking at the other reviews. But these shoes are great and are really waterproof. These were the only all black i could find, and the waterproof is a great addition. Light and comfortable shoes.
review.name: Surprisingly Great shoes

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for a trip to New York to keep my feet dry from the rain/ snow in Dec/ Jan. They worked great for a couple of days but developed a mysterious squeak which never went away. I’m also a heavier guy, so the cushioning was fine for walking, but I think it would struggle for running.  

And there’s no way I should be spending $170 on a pair of shoes that looks great but has so many compromises. Ultimately I ended up returning the shoes for a store credit.
review.name: Looked great, but started squeaking

review.reviewBody: I purchased these a few weeks ago and have requested to return them. They are comfortable and look great out of the box. However, after the first time I wore them the black material around the toes began to fade to a gray/white color. I purchased the all black color but after wearing for 5 days the toes on both shoes show fading. They are minimally worn but look like they are years old with heavy wear. Bummed because I did like them but for the price the material should hold up much better.
review.name: Material color changed
